panels.description: Shows the time in which the given percentage of reactor ticks completed, over the sampled timespan
panels.title: Reactor tick quantiles
Event Send Time Quantiles (excluding errors, all workers)
Event Send Time (Including errors, across all workers)
Event send time quantiles by worker

panels.description: CPU and DB time spent on most expensive state resolution in a room, summed over all workers. This is a very rough proxy for "how fast is state res", but it doesn't accurately represent the system load (e.g. it completely ignores cheap state resolutions).
panels.title: Stateres worst-case
DB usage by background jobs (including scheduling time)

panels.description:
Triangular growth may indicate a problem with federation sending from the remote host --- but it may also be the case that everyone is asleep and no messages are being sent.

See https://matrix-org.github.io/synapse/latest/usage/configuration/config_documentation.html#federation_metrics_domains
panels.title: Age of last PDU received from nominated hosts

panels.description:
Triangular growth may indicate a problem with federation senders on the monitored instance---but it may also be the case that everyone is asleep and no messages are being sent.

See https://matrix-org.github.io/synapse/latest/usage/configuration/config_documentation.html#federation_metrics_domains
panels.title: Age of last PDU sent to nominated hosts

panels.description: The number of events in the in-memory queues
panels.title: In-memory federation transmission queues

panels.description: Number of events queued up on the master process for processing by the federation sender
panels.title: Outgoing EDU queues on master
Age of oldest event in staging area
Number of events in federation staging area
Number of rate limit rejected requests
Number of requests being slept by the rate limiter

panels.description: Why is the data zero (0)? https://github.com/matrix-org/synapse/pull/13541#discussion_r951926322
panels.title: Number of hosts being rejected by the rate limiter

panels.description: https://github.com/matrix-org/synapse/pull/13541
panels.title: Number of hosts being slept by the rate limiter
Rate limit queue wait time Quantiles (all workers)

matcher.options: Default reject threshold (50 requests within a second)

targets.legendFormat: Default reject threshold (50 requests within a second)

panels.title: Rate of requests being slept by the rate limiter

panels.description: How many entries in current state that we are iterating over while calculating push rules.
panels.title: Iterations over State

panels.description: Rate that the cached push rules for a room get invalidated due to underlying push rules being changed.
panels.title: Push Rule Invalidations

panels.description:
How often the "delta optimisation" happens.

The delta optimisation is when we update the push rules for a room incrementally after a state change where we know the delta between the old state and the new state.

This can't happen if we don't the delta or we're calculating push rules from scratch.
panels.title: Delta Optimisation

panels.description: How often we have the correct cached push rules for a room.
panels.title: How often we reuse existing calculated push rules

panels.description:
How often we have existing cached push rules for the room. 

Note that these might be outdated and need to be recalculated if the state has changed.
panels.title: How often we have the RulesForRoom cached
Avg time waiting for db conn

panels.description: Shows the time in which the given percentage of database queries were scheduled, over the sampled timespan
panels.title: Db scheduling time quantiles
Top DB transactions by txn rate
DB transactions by total txn time
Time waiting for DB connection quantiles

panels.description: The time each database transaction takes to execute, on average, broken down by metrics block.
panels.title: Average Database Transaction time, by Block
Total GC time by bucket (10m smoothing)

panels.description:
'gen 0' shows the number of objects allocated since the last gen0 GC.
'gen 1' / 'gen 2' show the number of gen0/gen1 GCs since the last gen1/gen2 GC.

custom.axisLabel: Gen N-1 GCs since last Gen N GC

panels.title: Allocation counts
Rate of outgoing RDATA commands, by stream
Rate of incoming RDATA commands (excluding echoes), by stream
Queued incoming RDATA commands, by stream

panels.description:
Colour reflects the number of rooms with the given number of forward extremities, or fewer.

This is only updated once an hour.
panels.title: Number of rooms, by number of forward extremities in room

panels.description:
Number of rooms with the given number of forward extremities or fewer.

This is only updated once an hour.
panels.title: Room counts, by number of extremities

panels.description: Colour reflects the number of events persisted to rooms with the given number of forward extremities, or fewer.
panels.title: Events persisted, by number of forward extremities in room (heatmap)

panels.description: For a given percentage P, the number X where P% of events were persisted to rooms with X forward extremities or fewer.
panels.title: Events persisted, by number of forward extremities in room (quantiles)

panels.description:
Colour reflects the number of events persisted to rooms with the given number of stale forward extremities, or fewer.

Stale forward extremities are those that were in the previous set of extremities as well as the new.
panels.title: Events persisted, by number of stale forward extremities in room (heatmap)

panels.description:
For  given percentage P, the number X where P% of events were persisted to rooms with X stale forward extremities or fewer.

Stale forward extremities are those that were in the previous set of extremities as well as the new.

custom.axisLabel: Number of stale forward extremities in room

panels.title: Events persisted, by number of stale forward extremities in room (quantiles)

panels.description: Colour reflects the number of state resolution operations performed over the given number of state groups, or fewer.
panels.title: Number of state resolution performed, by number of state groups involved (heatmap)

panels.description: For a given percentage P, the number X where P% of state resolution operations took place over X state groups or fewer.
panels.title: Number of state resolutions performed, by number of state groups involved (quantiles)

panels.description: When we do a state res while persisting events we try and see if we can prune any stale extremities.
panels.title: Stale extremity dropping
